sen.j: 杉原 家次（すぎはら いえつぐ）は、戦国時代_(日本)の武将。
sen.e: Ietsugu SUGIHARA was a warlord of the Sengoku period (period of warring states) (Japan).
Ietsugu SUGIHARA was a warlord of the Sengoku period (period of warring states) (Japan).
Ietsugu SUGIHARA was a warlord of the Sengoku period (period of warring states) (Japan).
He was a vassal of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
He was a vassal of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
He was a vassal of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 羽柴秀吉の正室・寧々（高台院）の叔父に当たる。
sen.e: He was an uncle of Nene (Kodaiin), a lawful wife of Hideyoshi HASHIBA.
He was an uncle of Nene (Kodaiin), a lawful wife of Hideyoshi HASHIBA.
He was an uncle of Nene (Kodaiin), a lawful wife of Hideyoshi HASHIBA.

sen.j: その縁のため、早くから秀吉の家老として仕えた。
sen.e: Because of the relation, he served as karo (chief retainer) of Hideyoshi from an early period.
Because of the relation, he served as karo (chief retainer) of Hideyoshi from an early period.
Because of the relation, he served as karo (chief retainer) of Hideyoshi from an early period.

sen.j: 1582年の山崎の戦い後、秀吉から丹波国福知山城主に任じられた。
sen.e: After the Battle of Yamazaki in 1582, he was appointed to the lord of Fukuchiyama-jo Castle in the Tamba Province by Hideyoshi.
After the Battle of Yamazaki in 1582, he was appointed to as lord of Fukuchiyama-jo Castle in the Tamba Province by Hideyoshi.
After the Battle of Yamazaki in 1582, he was appointed to as lord of Fukuchiyama-jo Castle in the Tanba Province by Hideyoshi.

sen.j: 翌年の賤ヶ岳の戦い後には3万2000石の知行を与えられ、さらに京都所司代にも任じられた。
sen.e: After the Battle of Shizugatake in the next year, he was granted chigyo (enfeoffment) of 32 thousand koku and also appointed to Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy).
After the Battle of Shizugatake in the next year, he was granted chigyo (enfeoffment) of 32 thousand koku and also appointed to Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy).
After the Battle of Shizugatake in the next year, he was granted chigyo (enfeoffment) of 32 thousand koku and also appointed to Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy).
On September 9, 1584, he died.
On September 9, 1584, he died.
On September 9, 1584, he died.
Age at death: 55.
Age at death: 55.
Age at death: 55.

sen.j: 後を子の長房が継いだ。
sen.e: His son Nagafusa inherited him.
His son Nagafusa inherited him.
His son Nagafusa inherited him.
